subject: RE: [junit] written recommendation of super.setUp/tearDown ?
msgSnippet: ... David Saff ... Really?  That s surprising because it would completely break backward compatibility, something that Erich said they were going to preserve
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David Saff

> Allan,
>
> To the best of my knowledge, JUnit 4 will automatically
> ensure that setup and teardown methods from superclasses are
> called at the appropriate time.

Really? That's surprising because it would completely break backward
compatibility, something that Erich said they were going to preserve at all
costs.
